source.name: Understanding Blockchain Testnets
source.instructions: Select all statements that correctly describe blockchain testnets:

answers.answer: Testnets use real cryptocurrency with monetary value
Testnets are used for experimenting with new features without risk to the main blockchain
Ethereum's current active testnets include Sepolia and Holesky
Testnet coins can be freely obtained from faucets
All blockchains use the same testnet

source.guidance:
The correct answers are:

1. Testnets are used for experimenting with new features without risk to the main blockchain.
2. Ethereum's current active testnets include Sepolia and Holesky.
3. Testnet coins can be freely obtained from faucets.

These statements accurately describe testnets as presented in the topic. Testnets are indeed used for testing and experimentation without risk to the main chain. Ethereum currently has two active testnets: Sepolia and Holesky. Testnet coins have no real value and can be obtained freely from faucets.

The incorrect options state that testnets use real cryptocurrency with monetary value (they use separate coins with no value) and that all blockchains use the same testnet (each blockchain has its own testnets).
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT differentiate between testnets and mainnets in blockchain technology
